persons.note_text: also known as: Raṅganātha Paṇḍita, Raṃganāth Paṃḍita, Raṃganātha Paṃḍīta; born: 1773;  father: Vrajanātha Pauḍyāla; siblings: Kṛṣṇa Pauḍyāla, Viṣṇu Pauḍyāla, Nārāyaṇa Pauḍyāla (Pauḍela VS 2072: 4); details: grew up in India; established ties to Raṇabahādura Śāha in 1800 and returned with him to Kathmandu in 1804; became the personal guru to Queen Regent Lalitatripurasundarī (cf. Whelpton 1991: 37); sold (together with his brothers) several birtās in Salyan for 3.201 rupees to Mahanta Rūpanātha in 1854 (VS 1910 Naraharinātha VS 2022: 462), a transaction offcially confirmed by King Surendra in 1872 (VS 1929) only (Naraharinātha VS 2022: 464f., K_0469_0020); normdata:
king of Patan (r. 1661–1685). normdata: wiki: Srinivasa_Malla

terms.meaning:
[fr. A.] var. amāli, ambāli, amvalī, aṃvalī; also amālidāra; n. a revenue official or functionary of a regional administrative unit (Pant and Pierce 1989: 93, M.R. Pant 2002: 131).
According to Krauskopff and Meyer he had only "minor judicial powers" (Krauskopff and Meyer 2000: 183).
Kumar further notes that he was a "subordinate civil functionary in the tehsil" (Kumar 1967: 164).
His office was called amala (cf. Adhikari 1984: 344, M.C. Regmi 1978: 853). t.t.
